meanings.definition: The quality or state of being territorial.
meanings.sent1: The territorialities of the cat were evident as it marked its territory with scratches.
meanings.sent2: Birds often show territorialities by singing loudly to warn others to stay away.
meanings.sent3: The territorialities of the squirrel were so extreme that it chased away a much larger animal.
meanings.sent4: The territorialities of the lion were like a fortress protecting its domain.
meanings.sent5: The territorialities of the dog were so strong that even the mailman knew to be cautious.

meanings.definition: The behaviors or actions associated with defending or marking a territory.
meanings.sent1: The territorialities of the bear included growling and standing on its hind legs.
meanings.sent2: The territorialities of the wolf pack were evident as they howled to warn intruders.
meanings.sent3: The territorialities of the penguin led to a comical chase around the icy terrain.
meanings.sent4: The territorialities of the soldier ants were like a well-coordinated army defending their land.
meanings.sent5: The territorialities of the bee were as busy and organized as a bustling city.
